description: Shortened form of "how d'ye do" (i.e. how do you do) or less commonly "how do you fare?".

verbs.description: howdy (third-person singular simple present howdies, present participle howdying, simple past and past participle howdied)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To greet informally, especially by saying "howdy"
examples: I stood up for the kid and it got ugly, with accusations being thrown in both directions. So the sheriff and I weren't exactly on howdying terms when that fire happened.
